node.text:
In time for summer. For Krug x Onion, Chef @arnaud.faye, Executive Chef at Château @lachevredor in the south of France, puts a spin on a regional favourite by preparing Pissaladière tiles with onion dough, olives, and anchovies to pair with Krug Grande Cuvée 169ème Édition. 

“It is an intemporal Champagne. The finesse of the bubbles and the intensity of flavours make it a truly special experience.” – Chef Arnaud Faye.

#krugchampagne #krugxonion

node.text:
Onion and spice.

With his Lamb Tripe, Braised Madras Onions recipe, Chef @prateeksadhu brings a taste of home to Krug x Onion. “In Kashmir where I grew up, we have some of the best sheep in the area and I wanted to make something from my mother’s kitchen. The onions give the lamb a delightful sweetness and the subtle use of spice is just enough to accentuate the palate of Krug Rosé.”

#krugchampagne #krugxonion

node.text:
“I thought about a recipe that would be eco-friendly by choosing local ingredients to salvage from what might otherwise be discarded from your refrigerator or pantry: dry bread, pieces of cheese and onion. The ingredients are simple, but with a great Champagne, reconcile the most elegant of paradoxes. This pairing with Krug Rosé 23ème Édition is ideal for the intensity expressed in the Champagne through the Pinot Noir and Meunier, but, most of all, for the mineral richness and savoury notes that contrast with the sweetness of the onion.” @cicciosultano1 

#krugxonion #krugchampagne

node.text:
Chef Simon Davies was one of 11 Chefs who embarked on a culinary journey of discovery to India with Cellar Master Julie Cavil. 

He says of his Krug x Onion pairing: “I wanted to pay homage to India and use ingredients and flavours local to the area. It was important that onion shine in this dish and play off of the Champagne in a unique way.”

@simon.a.davies 

#krugxchampagne #krugxonion

“The onion is indispensable in the kitchen because it brings texture and different flavours to any dish – be it from Japanese or global cuisine."
Chef Hiroyuki Kanda @hiroyukkanda 

#krugxonion #krugchampagne

node.text:
Having spent his childhood in Germany, where the onion is a key component to many traditional dishes, Chef Opocensky’s family even grew onions in their garden, so he has always been around them. “To me, cooking without onion is like cooking without soul.” @uweo 

#krugxonion #krugchampagne

node.text:
[Sound ON!]

From Tokyo to Chicago, Mumbai or London, 11 highly talented Chefs joined Krug Cellar Master Julie Cavil on a voyage to India’s culinary backbone, unleashing their imagination and creating unique onion-inspired recipes to pair with a glass of Krug. Over a three-day immersion, they experience first-hand how the Rajasthani interact with the onion, discovering inspiring new recipes and farming techniques while building friendships along the way. In 2021, become acquainted with @simon.a.davies , @chefangusmcintosh , @tristinfarmer , @uweo , @cheftheoclench , @cicciosultano1 , @prateeksadhu , @hiroyukkanda , @heiko_nieder , @der_reiser, @sushijin.kimura, and get a peelin’ for their unique styles. 

#krugxonion #krugchampagne

node.text:
Chef @guillaumegalliot and sommelier @victorpetiot of Krug Ambassade Caprice at the @fshongkong in Hong Kong S.A.R., China take on the Krug Cuisine Challenge.

This recipe is a new interpretation of Chef Galliot signature Cocoa Pigeon, with the addition of a mole sauce made from Piquillo peppers and strawberries.

Discover how the pigeon meat, pepper spice and strawberry sweetness are accentuated by a glass of Krug Rosé 23ème Édition.

#KrugChampagne #WorldofCraft #FoodPairing

node.text:
Harvest is near. 
We, at Krug, are ready to welcome the gift of nature.
#krugchampagne

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Krug Champagne on September 05, 2021. May be an image of bottle and indoor.

node.text:
The House of Krug is delighted to present Krug 2008 after 12 years gaining in finesse in our cellars.

Nicknamed “Classic Beauty” by our Tasting Committee, this Champagne is one of our creations around the harvest of 2008.

#krugchampagne

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Krug Champagne on September 01, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, bottle and indoor.

node.text:
Discover Les Créations de 2008, two different expressions of nature crafted around the harvest of 2008.
 
In 2017 Krug Grande Cuvée 164ème Edition emerged from our cellars for the first time. Today, we are delighted to present Krug 2008.

#krugchampagne

Photo by Krug Champagne on August 28, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'UG EDITION CUVÉE CHAMPAGNE RANDECUVEE NM-549-001 750ml Servings pax JEJU Fried Chicken with Onion Yang Yum Jang, Doenjang Aioli & Yogurt Dip Preparation time 30 Cooking time 20 min'.

Photo by Krug Champagne on August 28, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'INGREDIENTS GARNISHES Olive oil Herbs DOUGLAS KIM Various alliums (chive, pickled ramps, pearl onions) YOGURT ONION DIP WITH CAVIAR 50g egg yolks 120g sherry vinegar ·15g lime juice 20g garlic 15g salt 5g pepper 25g onion powder 150g neutral oil 100g doenjang 200g yogurt'.

Photo by Krug Champagne on August 28, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'INSTRUCTIONS JEJU fried chicken Brine chicken overnight. Drain, then soak DOUGLAS KIM in buttermilk and coat in flour. Fry at 300F until cooked thoroughly. Remove from pan and finish with a light coating of Chicken Dust. Onion Yang Yum Jang Mix all together. Onion Doenjang Aioli Blend all together until smooth. Yogurt Onion Dip with Caviar Blend items below until smooth.'.

node.text:
With us on the Single Ingredient trip to Jaipur, Krug Ambassade Chef @tristinfarmer of @restaurantzen.sgp in Singapore experienced first-hand how the Rajasthani interact with one of his favourite ingredients.

“I love using onions because they are particularly versatile. Slow cooking will bring out their natural sweetness while roasting enhances their umami and a caramelised onion can be almost bitter.”
#KrugChampagne #KrugxOnion

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Krug Champagne on August 16, 2021. May be an image of food and text that says 'CHAMPAGNE KRUG GRANDECUVER LAANDE CUVER M Servings pax Amadai with Crispy Scales and Leek "Somen Noodles" Preparation time 35 min Cooking time min'.

node.text:
Trained in the disciplines of kaiseki, izakaya and soba, Michelin-starred Krug Ambassade Chef @brandon_hayato_go crafts his Krug x Onion creation from a Japanese point of view.

“I thought it was important to play off the sweetness of a leek while keeping the flavors gentle and elegant in order to allow the wine to assert itself. I love eating fried food with Krug Grande Cuvée, and the crunchy scales of the fish add the perfect textural component to make this recipe start as a playful snack food but still satisfy as a bonafide seafood dish.”

#KrugChampagne #KrugxOnion #KrugGrandeCuvee

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Krug Champagne on August 16, 2021. May be an image of food and text that says 'CHAMPAGNE KRUG GRANDECUVER LAANDE CUVER M Servings pax Amadai with Crispy Scales and Leek "Somen Noodles" Preparation time 35 min Cooking time min'.

Photo by Krug Champagne on August 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'INGREDIENTS BRANDONFAXATO SANDON BRANDON HAYATO GO •Whole Amandai •Large scallion or leek •500ml light fish or vegetable stock •1/2 tsp light soy sauce •1 tbsp fresh ginger juice ·2 tbsp potato starch'.
Photo by Krug Champagne on August 16, 2021. May be an image of text.

Photo by Krug Champagne on August 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'INSTRUCTIONS BRANDON HAYATO GO 4. Add the julienned scallion to the sauce, and gently heat for about 5 minutes or until soft. 5. Skewer the fish with bamboo skewers (to prevent it from curling) and deep fry for 90 seconds at 180 degrees C, rest the fried fish on paper towel to remove excess oil. Ladle the scallion sauce onto a pre-heated plate and place the fried fish on top of the sauce.'.

node.text:
Layers of expression. Chef @prateeksadhu’s recipe for Krug x Onion combines braised madras onion sauce, fermented onion juice, onion bread and onion oil. 

“I cook the onions slowly until they become brown and then pressure cook the tripe and lamb stock with onions. When you put everything together, the flavours really come through. Krug Rosé goes especially well with this recipe.” – Chef Prateek Sadhu

#krugchampagne #krugxonion
